intro: Dissotis paucistellata, commonly known as the small-stalked devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
